turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Courtenay, British Columbia.
turn.1: What was the first major industry in Courtenay, British Columbia?
turn.2: McPhee built a store beside the bridge, while Pidcock built the Courtenay River's first commercial enterprise, a saw mill.
turn.3: When did the second industry begin?
turn.4: In 1888 Robert Dunsmuir established a mine in nearby Union, later renamed Cumberland, which brought an influx of settlers, and Chinese and Japanese immigrants.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: McPhee and Pidcock recognized the economic potential of a townsite on the western bank of the river, which would be closer to the mines.
turn.7: Did many people settle in this townsite?
turn.8: They hired a surveyor, George Drabble, to survey and subdivide their land into town lots, which they quickly sold to businessmen and homeowners.
turn.9: What other things happened in the years 1900-1910?
turn.10: The townsite on the much drier west side of the river, called for a time "New Courtenay", quickly developed.
turn.12: Many of the stores and businesses centred on what was originally called Union Street (now 5th Street), which ascended from McPhee's bridge.
